definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: This bloke was breaking the unwritten rules for men.
sentences.chinese: 这个家伙打破了男人们应该遵守的不成文规则。

sentences.english: There's a kind of unwritten law about what to wear.
sentences.chinese: 关于穿什么有种不成文法。

sentences.english: Often it's the rule and not the exception.
sentences.chinese: 通常这无一例外的成了一条不成文的规则。

sentences.english: The authorities deny seizing land and blame ancient, unwritten ownership laws.
sentences.chinese: 官方否认了征地，谴责那种传统不成文的赌地权法律。

sentences.english: The unwritten laws of good sportsmanship.
sentences.chinese: 爱丽斯被指责违反这条不成文法。
但是，要记住一个不成文的规定。

sentences.english: This is an understandable tactic in this world of media-driven politics.
sentences.chinese: 这在现今媒体炒作的政治世界中是一条不成文的策略。

sentences.english: Alice is accused of sinning against this unwritten law.
sentences.chinese: 爱丽斯被指责违反这条不成文法。

sentences.english: This is also of the servant girls unspoken rules.
sentences.chinese: 这也是丫鬟们之间不成文的规矩。

sentences.english: Under those unwritten laws, people were naturally reluctant to use their brains.
sentences.chinese: 在这种不成文法底下，人们就不愿意去动脑筋了。

definition: established by popular usage (idiom); common usage agreement/customary convention
lit. compass and set square/fig. established standard/rule/customs/practices/fig. upright and honest/well-behaved
unspoken rules (usually ones that codify improper behaviors such as leveraging guanxi to get favorable treatment, or coercing employees for sexual favors)
to comply with/to abide by/to respect (an agreement)
provision/to fix/to set/to formulate/to stipulate/to provide/regulation/rule/CL:個|个[ge4]
to state in writing (laws, rules etc)
scientific law (e.g. law of conservation of energy)/(in human affairs) a generalization based on observation (e.g. "power corrupts")
